Table of Contents

Name

gluErrorString - produce an error string from a GL or GLU error code

C Specification

const GLubyte * gluErrorString( GLenum error ) 


 eqn not supported


Parameters






error 


Specifies a GL or GLU error code. 





Description

gluErrorString
produces an error string from a GL or GLU error code. The string is in ISO
Latin 1 . For example, gluErrorString(GL_OUT_OF_MEMORY) returns the string
 out of memory. 

The standard GLU error codes are GLU_INVALID_ENUM,  GLU_INVALID_VALUE,
and GLU_OUT_OF_MEMORY. Certain other GLU functions can return specialized
error codes through callbacks. See the glGetError reference page for the
list of  GL error codes. 

Errors

NULL is returned if error is not a valid
GL or GLU error code. 

See Also

glGetError(3G)
, gluNurbsCallback(3G)
, gluQuadricCallback(3G)
,
gluTessCallback(3G)
